decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor to quickly ramp out lands and overwhelm opponents with powerful creature attacks. It also includes various utility lands and spells to provide flexibility and disruption against opposing strategies. The key strategy revolves around efficiently tutoring for key pieces and exploiting the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands to generate massive amounts of mana and flood the board with threats. The deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and quickly close out games through its combo potential and strong mid-to-late game threats.

The main concept of this Spirit Aggro deck is to swarm the board with powerful Spirit creatures and use cards like Collected Company and Aether Vial to quickly put them into play. Cards like Drogskol Captain and Supreme Phantom provide buffs to the spirits, while Spell Queller and Deputy of Detention help control the opponent's board. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Ethersworn Canonist slow down the opponent's plays, allowing the spirits to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory through aggressive attacks.

This deck focuses on quickly playing spells to maximize the potential of Pyromancer Ascension and trigger effects that bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. The strategy is to play cheap spells like Faithless Looting, Serum Visions, and Lightning Bolt to set up the board for aggressive attacks with Arclight Phoenix and Thing in the Ice. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Surgical Extraction and Echoing Truth to control the opponent's board and maintain pressure. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and direct damage spells.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It also utilizes powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage, Tasigur, and Nicol Bolas to apply pressure when needed. The deck aims to control the game by efficiently removing threats and controlling the board, while also digging for key cards with Search for Azcanta. The mana base is designed to provide the right colors of mana needed to cast the spells in the deck consistently.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base and slow down their game plan while deploying aggressive threats that can quickly close out the game. By utilizing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter alongside cards like Chalice of the Void, the deck can restrict the opponent's options and buy time to establish a board presence. With powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, the deck can quickly apply pressure and overwhelm the opponent. Ultimately, this deck seeks to punish opponents for their reliance on non-basic lands and disrupt their game plan while beating them down with efficient creatures.

This deck revolves around quickly pumping up small infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent with a combination of pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth to deal 10 poison counters in a single turn for a lethal infect win. Using cards like Noble Hierarch and Mishra's Bauble to accelerate the strategy, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents with its fast and explosive plays, aiming to win the game before the opponent can establish a solid defense.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly swarm the board with powerful Human creatures and disrupt opponent's game plan with disruptive spells like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. The mana base is designed to support the different colors required for the creatures, with Aether Vial helping to cheat them into play. The creatures benefit from each other with Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish growing stronger as more Humans enter the battlefield. This deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and disruptive to overwhelm the opponent.

The focus of this Big Red Control deck is to utilize powerful red dragons and planeswalkers to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By playing disruptive spells like Blood Moon and Anger of the Gods, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while utilizing efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Skred to deal with threats. The key strategy is to ramp into powerful threats like Glorybringer and Skarrgan Hellkite while using cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Sarkhan, Fireblood to generate card advantage and mana acceleration.

The focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is on disruption and removal spells to control the pace of the game while develop a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek while removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Tireless Tracker and Scavenging Ooze to generate card advantage and gain incremental life to out-value the opponent in the long game.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of artifact creatures that benefit from artifacts such as Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer. By using cards like Galvanic Blast for removal and efficient mana acceleration through Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, the deck aims to win through damage before the opponent can establish a defense. The key strategy revolves around utilizing the synergy between artifacts and creatures to create a fast and deadly aggro strategy, taking advantage of the synergy between cards like Arcbound Ravager and Vault Skirge to close out games quickly.

This deck revolves around filling your graveyard with cards like Creeping Chill, Faithless Looting, and Life from the Loam to recur powerful creatures like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam. By constantly dredging cards from your library and utilizing cards like Conflagrate and Darkblast, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures and powerful spells. The key strategy is to consistently dredge your deck to put as many cards in your graveyard as possible, enabling explosive plays and overwhelming your opponent with powerful graveyard recursion.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy and managing the board with counter spells and removal. By using cards like Terminus, Cryptic Command, and Path to Exile, the deck aims to maintain control over the game while also leveraging powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for card advantage and board presence. The deck also includes some card draw and graveyard hate to further support its control strategy and outlast the opponent.
